intro: Reseda tymphaea, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray leaves covered in fine hairs. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. Reseda tymphaea is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils due to its tolerance for saline conditions. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, making it an important species in ecological habitats.
